ai-patthana22.1:0.2_0: under the influence of the Dhamma: the Protector of the Three Worlds
ai-patthana22.1:1.1_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-patthana22.1:2.1_0: Not unskillful qualities give rise to the cause, for the sake of the skillful,
ai-patthana22.1:2.1_1: It’s not possible to give a teaching without cause or reason.
ai-patthana22.1:3.1_0: It’s not possible to give a teaching because of what is skillful and unskillful,
ai-patthana22.1:3.1_1: It’s not easy for someone who doesn’t give rise to unskillful things.
ai-patthana22.1:4.1_0: One should not give rise to a cause or reason for this skillful teaching.
ai-patthana22.1:4.1_1: One should not give rise to a cause or reason for the sake of this teaching.
ai-patthana22.1:5.1_0: Not skilled in loss, or cause or reasons.
ai-patthana22.1:5.1_1: Not skilled in loss, or cause or reasons.
ai-patthana22.1:5.1_2: You don’t give rise to unskillful qualities because of what is skillful and unskillful, with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.1:5.1_3: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana22.1:7.1_0: Not unskillful qualities give rise to the cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.1:7.1_1: Not by the goal, not with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.1:7.1_2: Not skilled in teaching, or cause or reason, these three things don’t give rise to unskillful qualities because of cause or reason.
ai-patthana22.1:8.1_0: Not with the cause or condition, skilled in the teaching, and no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.1:8.1_1: Not by the Teaching, or by cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.1:8.1_2: Not with the cause or condition, nor skillful qualities arise, or dependently originated.
ai-patthana22.1:9.1_0: Not declared by the Buddha, the teaching, or by not grasping.
ai-patthana22.1:10.1_0: Not unskillful qualities arise or cause or reason.
ai-patthana22.1:11.1_0: Not unskillful qualities arise or cause or reason.
ai-patthana22.1:12.1_0: Not skilled in loss, or cause or reason,
ai-patthana22.1:12.1_1: This is the section in brief.
